issues.title: Missing Mandatory Reporting to CTC for Arrests
issues.description: The regulation only addresses reporting to the Commission on Teacher Credentialing (CTC) when employment status changes due to misconduct or while misconduct allegations are pending. However, Education Code requires reporting of arrests for certain offenses within 24 hours, regardless of employment action.

legal_citations.text: The employing agency shall report to the commission, by telephone within 24 hours and in writing within 48 hours, whenever any of the following occurs: (1) A certificated employee is arrested for, charged with, or convicted of any offense set forth in Section 44010 or 44011.

issues.required_language: The Superintendent or designee shall report to the Commission on Teacher Credentialing by telephone within 24 hours and in writing within 48 hours whenever a certificated employee is arrested for, charged with, or convicted of any offense set forth in Education Code 44010 or 44011.

issues.title: Missing Child Abuse Reporting Requirements
issues.description: Neither document addresses the specific requirement to report to CTC when a certificated employee is dismissed, non-reelected, suspended, placed on leave, or resigns due to allegations of child abuse.

legal_citations.text: The employing agency shall report to the commission whenever...a certificated employee is dismissed, non-reelected, suspended for more than 10 days, placed on administrative leave for more than 10 days, or resigns or otherwise leaves employment while allegations of misconduct are pending when the allegation involves...child abuse or neglect as defined in Section 11165.6 of the Penal Code.

issues.required_language: The Superintendent or designee shall report to the Commission on Teacher Credentialing whenever a certificated employee is dismissed, non-reelected, suspended for more than 10 days, placed on administrative leave for more than 10 days, or resigns or otherwise leaves employment while allegations of misconduct are pending when the allegation involves child abuse or neglect as defined in Penal Code 11165.6.

issues.title: Missing Sexual Misconduct Reporting Requirements
issues.description: The documents do not specifically address reporting requirements when employment actions are taken due to sexual misconduct allegations, which have specific CTC reporting mandates.

legal_citations.text: The employing agency shall report to the commission whenever...a certificated employee is dismissed, non-reelected, suspended for more than 10 days, placed on administrative leave for more than 10 days, or resigns or otherwise leaves employment while allegations of misconduct are pending when the allegation involves...sex offenses as defined in Section 44010.

issues.required_language: The Superintendent or designee shall report to the Commission on Teacher Credentialing whenever a certificated employee is dismissed, non-reelected, suspended for more than 10 days, placed on administrative leave for more than 10 days, or resigns or otherwise leaves employment while allegations of misconduct are pending when the allegation involves sex offenses as defined in Education Code 44010.

issues.title: Missing Controlled Substance Offense Reporting
issues.description: While the regulation mentions controlled substance offenses in the context of compulsory leave, it does not address the specific CTC reporting requirements for employment actions related to controlled substance allegations.

legal_citations.text: The employing agency shall report to the commission whenever...a certificated employee is dismissed, non-reelected, suspended for more than 10 days, placed on administrative leave for more than 10 days, or resigns or otherwise leaves employment while allegations of misconduct are pending when the allegation involves...controlled substance offenses as defined in Section 44011.

issues.required_language: The Superintendent or designee shall report to the Commission on Teacher Credentialing whenever a certificated employee is dismissed, non-reelected, suspended for more than 10 days, placed on administrative leave for more than 10 days, or resigns or otherwise leaves employment while allegations of misconduct are pending when the allegation involves controlled substance offenses as defined in Education Code 44011.

issues.title: Missing Reference to Updated Penal Code Section
issues.description: The regulation references Penal Code 11165.2-11165.6 for child abuse and neglect definitions, but current law primarily uses Penal Code 11165.6 as the comprehensive definition section.

legal_citations.text: "Child abuse or neglect" includes physical injury or death inflicted by other than accidental means upon a child by another person; sexual abuse of a child; neglect of a child; willful harming or injuring of a child or the endangering of the person or health of a child; and unlawful corporal punishment or injury.

issues.required_language: Update reference to "child abuse and neglect as described in Penal Code 11165.6" for consistency with current statutory language.
